audit.description: A collection of audit logs for tracking changes or activities. The specific structure of each log is not defined.

external_id.description: A unique identifier for the business used in external systems. (deperecated, use external_reference_id)

external_reference_id.description: Another identifier used for referencing the business in external or third-party systems.

identities.description: A list of identities associated with the business. This could include various user or entity IDs.

in_setup.description: Indicates whether the business is in the setup process. True if in setup, false otherwise.

intents.description: A list of intents or purposes associated with the business. Defines business objectives or goals.

invite.description: An invite code or identifier used for inviting users to the business or a specific function.

is_template.description: Indicates if the current business meta is a template. Templates can be used as a basis for new instances.

note.description: A general note or comment about the business. Can be used for additional information not captured elsewhere.

suggested_identities.description: A list of suggested identities for the business, possibly recommended during setup or integration.

tags.description: Tags associated with the business for categorization or organization purposes.

template_business_id.description: If this business meta is based on a template, this is the ID of that template business.

description: The BusinessMeta schema defines various metadata properties associated with a business entity, including analytics, identity information, state indicators, and categorization tags.

example.note: This is a sample business meta for demonstration.
